title: Watch: Has Andrew Tate been charged with rape? Or for going against the narrative?
description:
Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan are headed to trial in Romania.

By law, Romanian prosecutors MUST formally indict within 180 days or release suspects. This coming Monday marks the 180 day limit. The Tate brothers are being formally charged with rape and human trafficking. A Romanian judge will have 60 days to inspect the case before a potential trial begins, which could last years.

“BREAKING: Andrew and Tristan Tate Charged After a 15-month-long investigation. The charges against them include: - Rape - Human trafficking - Formation of an organized crime group The allegations claim the Tates formed an organized criminal group in Romania, the US, the UK and…”
— Mario Nawfal (@Mario Nawfal) 1687265998

Here's the thing, you can hold two opinions at the same time. Andrew Tate is no model citizen. However, there are many who believe Tate’s persecution is meant to stamp out voices going against the approved globalist left narrative.

Crowder and the gang did a deep dive on today's show into who Andrew Tate is, the timeline that led to the charges, and a number of things were are being told that simply do not add up.

title: "Prince Harry's a f***ing t***": Kelly Osbourne unloads on the former prince with some sweet Nepo Baby on Nepo Baby beef
description:
This post goes against two rules of mine. One is anything having to do with the Royal Family. The other is acknowledging anything Ozzy Osbourne related after 1991's "No More Tears." There's something about the former Prince Harry that makes you want to revel in his misery. Plus, calling someone a "tw*t" is my go-to insult. I would have also accepted Prince Harry is a sh*tc*nt.

Kelly Osbourne, the floor is yours.

\u201cKelly Osbourne has thoughts about #PrinceHarry \ud83d\ude02\ud83d\ude02\ud83d\ude02 we all agree, Kelly.\n\n#PrinceHarryIsATwat\n#PrinceHarryAndHisStupidWife\u201d
— State of Flux (@State of Flux) 1687248816

"I think Harry is a f*cking twat. I think he's a f*cking twat. I think he's a whining, whinging, complaining 'woe is me,' 'I'm the only who that's ever had mental problems,' 'my life is so hard.' Everybody's f*cking life is hard," says Ozzy Osbourne's daughter.

She continues, "You were the prince of a g*ddamn county who dressed up as a f*cking Nazi, and now you're trying to come back as the pope? Suck it."

Harry, who is now the black sheep of the Royal Family (and one of them is a pedo) is taking it from all sides. Spotify executive Bill Simmons unloaded on the royal grifters after their twenty million dollar Spotify deal produced sh*t content and the two sides "mutually" decided to part ways.

“‘The F*cking Grifters.’ That’s the podcast we should have launched with them. I have got to get drunk one night and tell the story of the Zoom I had with Harry to try and help him with a podcast idea. It’s one of my best stories … F*ck them. The grifters.”

The irony of a nepo baby going after another nepo baby for being a nepo baby is not lost on me. "Nepo baby" is the hip new term starf*ckers use to glorify people who only exist because their parents are rich and famous. To acknowledge Kelly as a nepo baby would be to acknowledge Ozzy Osbourne after he sung "Mama, I'm Coming Home." Also, rich and famous parents or not, she's not wrong. Prince Harry is a tw*t.

Now if you'll all join hands in a moment of prayer to the deity or deities of content, that in their divine wisdom, they allow #PrinceHarryIsATwat and #PrinceHarryAndHisStupidWife trend today, everyone here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website would humbly sing their praise.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: "Just shut up": SNL alumni torches Garth Brooks for involving himself in the Bud Light fiasco
description:
Garth Brooks discovered the hard way not to dip your toe in political issues when you don't know what the deuce you're talking about. SNL alumni Rob Schneider has three simple words of advice for the alter-ego of Chris Gaines: "Just shut up."

The drama started when Garth was doing an interview with Billboard about his new Nashville restaurant, the Friends In Low Places Bar & Honky Tonk. The little he knew about the Bud Light drama was clear in his comments: "And yes, we’re going to serve every brand of beer. We just are. [...] If you’re an a**hole, there are plenty of other places on lower Broadway."

The millions and millions of Americans who have made it so Bud Light is no longer the #1 beer in America, many of whom are country music fans, didn't take kindly to being called a**holes. Garth tried a more measured political response: "Everybody’s got their opinions. I think diversity is the answer to the problems that are here and the answer to the problems that are coming. So I love diversity. And if you’re one of those people that just can’t do that, I get it."

Rob Schneider did an interview with Fox Nation, and thinks Garth should do himself a favor by no longer talking:

"I think next time, he's going to stay out of it. Isn’t he? I think Garth Brooks, next time, is going to shut his mouth, and he's going to pretend like 'I don't have anything to do with what beer is chosen in my restaurant'," the comedian says. "I mean, just from a business standpoint, just shut up, say I have nothing to do with it."

Hey Brodigan? I've been in a coma for a month. Why does everyone hate Bud Light other than it being reconstituted bum piss?

For the five of you who need to be brought up to speed, here are Bud Light's Keys to Derp:

  1. As part of Bud Light's NCAA tournament coverage, and to appeal to people who don't like either for some reason, someone at Bud Light decided to work with titface performer Dylan Mulvaney.
  2. Melissa Weinerchild, the (now former) VP of Marketing responsible, made it clear on a podcast how much she hated Bud Light's loyal fanbase, lashing out at them as fratty and out of touch.
  3. Fans from across the spectrum (NOT just the extreme right, we're not that organized) decided this was one woke pander from a company that hates them too many, and now Bud Light is no longer the #1 beer in America.

I get that Garth is a busy man and it is possible he wasn't following the news. While a country entertainer, he is still in the entertainment industry. His PR rep probably told him the entire brewhaha was because the extreme MAGA right hates trans people. And that's the only reason Anheuser-Busch lost tens of b-b-b-BILLIONS OF DOLLARS. Even then, Garth should have had more sense than to call people a**holes. He used to be smarter than this.

Had he simply said his restaurant would sell every beer and left it at that, it would have been left at that. People aren't angry at bars for serving Bud Light. We go to bars all the time and order something else.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: Joe Biden needs to be led like a child after saying he'll solve the existential crisis of our time... by 2020
description:
They let Joe Biden leave the White House and do a campaign event again. Or, this could have been a presidential visit? His adoring fans don't show up for either, so it's hard to know the difference. When I say "senior," you say "abuse." SENIOR!

Biden traveled to Santa Clara County to either talk about schlimate change or ensure that Governor Gavin Newsom is NOT running a shadow campaign against him for president. Political observers believe that Newsom, if nothing else, is positioning himself as a candidate should Biden not make it to Iowa "due to health reasons." By "political observers," I mean hi. It's me. I'm the political observers. It's me.

Biden supporters (mostly the people relying on him for a job) swear that the president has never been more intelligible and coherent than he is now. For example, name me one other elected official with the drive and energy to conquer the largest existential crisis this country faces by the year... 2020.

\u201cBIDEN: "I've committed that by 2020, we will have conserved 30% of all the lands and waters..." \ud83e\udd14\u201d
— RNC Research (@RNC Research) 1687206660

Personally speaking, I would like to know more about businesses suing banks to make sure I'm environmentally...you know, the thing. There is a conspiracy on the right that woke companies, looking to get some of that globalist ESG cash, want to use your bank accounts and the items you buy to control your behavior on behalf of the radical left (aka the mainstream Democrat Party). Here's the president of the United States sounding like he forgot his meeting with Blackrock and Vanguard was super duper double top secret.

\u201cBIDEN: "A couple businesses are suing banks because they wanna consider whether or not you're environmentally\u2014 anyway, I won't get into all that, I'll get..."\u201d
— RNC Research (@RNC Research) 1687206441

And nothing says confidence in the man who has access to the nuclear football than watching him being led by the hand like he's a small child being forced to meet his auntie's friends after church.

\u201cRep. Anna Eshoo physically pulls Biden across the stage to meet with attendees after his speech\u201d
— RNC Research (@RNC Research) 1687206980

WHEN I SAY "SENIOR," YOU SAY "ABUSE." SENIOR!

At what point do Democrats say "enough is enough" and threaten to prosecute Hunter Biden themselves if Joe doesn't drop out of the race? Or at the very least, go back to hiding Joe Biden in the basement and getting a Biden impersonator like they did with Kevin Kline in Dave?

Don't get me wrong. Having Joe Biden as president is great for content. It just sucks for being an American.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.
